positive.review:
Will always be my favorite childhood game that I still play today.
if I can add the off record play time I would have over thousand winkwink.
I've played this game on 2012 for the first time. Now after a decade, I can enjoy it with my steam deck. Real-time-strategy games can help sharping your mind.
Best RTS! I've played since I was a kid over 20 years ago. Well balanced and just nuanced enough to keep it entertaining for years.

I’ve been playing Command & Conquer: Generals and Zero Hour since release. 
At this point, it’s less a game and more a long-term relationship. And honestly? “It’s a good run!”

The base game alone is pure RTS adrenaline - fast, chaotic, endlessly fun. Add mods and suddenly you're hearing yourself say “No system is safe!”, because the amount of new units, factions, campaigns, and crazy ideas the community pumps out is unreal. There’s always something fresh to blow up.

EA releasing the source code was basically the developers shouting: “We will not be oppressed!” And the community responded accordingly. For years, fans kept the game alive with patches and fixes, but now everything is cleaner, smoother, and even more ambitious. It’s one of the few RTS communities where “We stand together!” isn’t just a voice line - it’s reality.

If you want an RTS with endless replay value, a modding scene that can’t be stopped, and a community that’s more active than half the modern live-service titles out there… then “It will look real nice when it all explodes.”

In other words: this is the one.

Classic. Still an absolute blast to replay.
The variety of generals keeps the game fresh and fun, even if some of them are hilariously overpowered, but honestly, that’s part of its charm. A true RTS gem that still holds up today.
Oh yees, I played this game as a kid and spent incredible amount of time on it. Still love it. It would be interesting to see some remake to current tech if its even possible.
Fun game from my childhood, that I've continued to play over the last 20 years. I tend not to like strategy games that are sci-fi based, so Generals/Zero Hour have always been my go to.
Favourite multiplayer game of all time. So well balanced. Never gets old.
one of the childhood's memories game. Glad still can play and available in steam. Hoping for the new updated and remastered version.
This game was my childhood. Still looking good as I remember it back in the day.
I've enjoyed this game for years. I enjoy the no pay walls and custom difficulty to each mission.
Generals Zero Hour provides extensive gameplay with 3 vanilla factions plus 9 new subfactions, each with their own pros and cons. The game is well balanced too and I really enjoy the skirmish mode!

This game is such a blast! 
I usually play a lot of StarCraft 2, but this seems to be more present day. 
I'm really loving playing this game in multiplayer mode and especially with my son.  
It's great to come up with strategies and ways to beat the maps.

Generals Zero Hour is the best in serie CnC strategy game. I do recommend people playing this game. However this game is porting from old computing era so It's sometime crashing on a modern hardwares. It's bad experience while I was on a fierce battles. So I did uninstall.

I remember how my parents bought me a disc with this game back in 2004. We didn’t have a computer at home, so I would go to my dad’s or mom’s workplace, install it, play, and then delete it. Almost 22 years have passed, and I’m still playing it — a masterpiece!

Among the thousands of different games I've played, this is my favorite game of all time despite clearly not even being a great game by any standard. The AI is the typical cheating moron it is in every oldschool RTS, the community gave up on the balance of the game a very long time ago and has forced random mirrors in 1v1 tournaments for over two decades, and the online has always been fraught with desyncs and infamous for competitively relevant gameplay exploits. But it's great. This is lethal micro-intensive RTS at its finest, with the macro and strategizing reduced to a small fraction of the gameplay. Just set yourself up and put your heart and soul into every unit you make, and you'll win. This means that unlike most competitive RTS, you and your opponent are basically always looking at the same thing, the place where your units are closest to his units, except where a flanking gattling cannon (yeah they gave it a weirdly spelled name in this game) is shooting down chinooks to distract you from your micro, or is it the reverse? There are no chores back at base, just your broken combos vs his broken combos. No engineer rushes, but you can still win the game in under two minutes by hunting his dozers after he sells his CC for fast expand money. Or you can play a 30-minute GLA mirror and tech up to bus and buggy. Still a lot of micro and a lot of death prevention.

This is more of its own thing than a C&C, but you recognize a lot of C&C DNA in this game with its myriad hard counters, quick TTK, and superweapons intended to make turtleteching pointless. The node economy means the macro skill ceiling is even lower than previous C&C generations (though still higher than RA3) and you and your opponent are having more of a duel than a game of battleship. Sometimes it does feel like battleship with all the free airstrikes though. Oh and there's a campaign, which is actually better gameplay-wise than any Westwood campaign, but it's not for me. You get into this game for the multiplayer. and that takes modding and third-party accountmaking to get working. Quicker than it sounds.

FFA isn't stupid because the XP system massively rewards involvement in fights (to a point) and cannot be exploited passively. Tanks are mostly garbage, the game is primarily about rocket soldiers and their escorts/transports. Lots of alright mods for the game, like every C&C. Scrap your technicals up and make China players crave death. Thrax and Granger are more broken than Yuri ever was.

Zero Hour taught me that air superiority solves everything.
Command & Conquer Generals Zero:Hour at its absolute best. Three factions, nine crazy generals, and more explosions than your PC can handle. It’s old-school RTS chaos. Build, blow up, repeat. The Generals Challenge alone is worth it.

9/10 – Legendary strategy that never gets old. Tired of old show? Try mods.
I love committing war crimes and inflicting torment on my enemies
Best of the best strategy games out there. With fan-made mods it becomes a beast!
classic game for classic gamer
I mean, come on, it's C&C Zero Hour. This is classic C&C. It runs well on modern systems which is amazing.

"Preserving FREEDOM"

"Keep it clean"

"ITS THE RIGHT THING TO DO"
nostalgic all the way and still get goosebumps
Lots of fun and A game where you don't constantly rot your brain out
its command and conquer. what more to say
Legendary game, the era when EA made good games.
fun to play and interesting
It's such a pity that they're never going to make games like that again
its one game i return and play, still enjoy it

this version doesnt allow for offline play.
runs on win 10.
Highly recommended! Brings back the memories of my teenage days!!
Played this game for years, a classic and a must have
I have loved this game since it came out. If you love the older style games? You will enjoy this one as I have.
most addictive game ever created
the one and only OG game of war stratigy
Proper old school strategy game
Grapphics game set up
Get it with mods and this is a beast!!
A classic C&C game that never gets old.
i love my army of toyotas getting bombed in 2 seconds would recomend
Immortal classic. 10/10
Its really really really good
China will grow larger 我正在玩我的球和屎
IT IS THE GREATEST GAME EVER NO OTHER GAME COMES CLOSE !!!!!!!
The best game to ever have been made.
Good. Always Was
best RTS game ever made
old thats why its gold
old game but fun
It's a great game! I love it <3
One of my favorite RTS games
Brilliant game
Best game ever
love this game
Bestt C&C ever!!!!
Play for some nostalgia!
Finally in-game online game, you need to download the patch from https://www.playgenerals.online/
very noice

AK47s FOR EVERYONE!!!!!

Will always be my favorite childhood game that I still play today.
if I can add the off record play time I would have over thousand winkwink.
it's a legacy game for me and I'm so happy that it still exist, I wish if EA could give this game more attention and keep devolop it
Fun game. Wish there were more maps and more frequent updates.
I feel it's the best of command and conquer. Sandbox like and I wish they would make more like this game.

One of the greatest Real-Time Strategy games every made. My buddies and I have been playing since it originally came out, and we still play to this day. It has everything you want from a classic RTS: base building, resource gathering, 3 asymmetrical playable factions, single player story campaign, multiplayer, map editor, etc... It doesn't run great on modern systems out of the box, but with some third-party patches (Genpatcher & Gentool), you'll be able to use modern resolutions and play online. If you are an RTS fan and haven't played Generals yet, I would highly recommend checking it out. It's a bit different than other Command & Conquer games; it reminds me more of like Starcraft or Age of Empires in how it plays. Tons of fun. The unit dialogue is also fantastic and you'll find yourself quoting it all the time lol. I BUILD FOR CHINA.
I've played this game on 2012 for the first time. Now after a decade, I can enjoy it with my steam deck. Real-time-strategy games can help sharping your mind.

Absolutely sublime. This game feels fantastic to play. I've gotten acclimated to the various tricks and techniques from the base game with each faction, and this expansion gives me even more very welcome options (ranger flashbangs my beloved). This is the true and refined Generals experience. Though still lacking the campy B-movie cutscenes and not introducing anything new with the soundtrack, I do appreciate the newscaster clips at the start of each mission. Though not scratching that cheesy C&C itch, they are welcome nonetheless. The new missions are very engaging with various different scenarios you have to overcome, and the generals challenge mode is quite an interesting approach to a secondary singleplayer campaign.

This gets an A. Gameplay is exceptional and not to beat a dead horse, but the overall experience is still lacking the Klepacki tunes and C&C brand FMV clips.

The nostalgia hits hard, and it's still one of my all-time favourites — especially with the Shockwave Mod.
I recommend using GenPatcher, GenTool, and GenLauncher to get it running flawlessly on modern systems, play multiplayer, and easily switch between a great selection of mods.

To this day I still actively play Generals Zero Hour originally on my disk copy. I played this game for many hours (800 hours or even 1000 hours or more) using mods and normal game. Glad this game and rest of complete Command & Conquer™ The Ultimate Collection games finally on Steam bought it today as they are on sale. I played for the first time in many years multiplayer using Generals Online. It greatly improves the online game and adds fixes to bugs. I highly recommend this game.
Best RTS! I've played since I was a kid over 20 years ago. Well balanced and just nuanced enough to keep it entertaining for years.

EA releasing the source code was basically the developers shouting: “We will not be oppressed!” And the community responded accordingly. For years, fans kept the game alive with patches and fixes, but now everything is cleaner, smoother, and even more ambitious. It’s one of the few RTS communities where “We stand together!” isn’t just a voice line - it’s reality.

If you want an RTS with endless replay value, a modding scene that can’t be stopped, and a community that’s more active than half the modern live-service titles out there… then “It will look real nice when it all explodes.”

In other words: this is the one.
A really fun expansion of generals adds a cool challenge mode against the other sub factions as well lots of chaos

If you play the Chinese Nuke General challenges, there is the 4th challenge that includes a very annoying commander.
I stayed about 2 hours looking for the last worker

Classic. Still an absolute blast to replay.
The variety of generals keeps the game fresh and fun, even if some of them are hilariously overpowered, but honestly, that’s part of its charm. A true RTS gem that still holds up today.
Never thought I'd be playing this game many many years after its release. Easily, one of the best RTS games ever created.
Oh yees, I played this game as a kid and spent incredible amount of time on it. Still love it. It would be interesting to see some remake to current tech if its even possible.

I've *literally* played this game for 20 years (2005 to present).  If the environment doesn't dramatically improve I may still be playing it for 20 more years to come.  Thank you Steam for picking it up!!

Despite playing this several times over the years I still get hooked on the various nuances in the game that require a patient skilled approach to play. Trying to take short cuts invariably ends in a strategic disaster (at the higher levels of dificulty settings).
Fun game from my childhood, that I've continued to play over the last 20 years. I tend not to like strategy games that are sci-fi based, so Generals/Zero Hour have always been my go to.
Favourite multiplayer game of all time. So well balanced. Never gets old.
one of the childhood's memories game. Glad still can play and available in steam. Hoping for the new updated and remastered version.
This game was my childhood. Still looking good as I remember it back in the day.

negative.review:
It’s a great game and really brings back that nostalgic excitement. I bought the bundle so I’d have something to play when I don’t have internet access—especially since I’m often on a vessel where the connection is limited. But when I tried playing this game offline, it wouldn’t start at all.

I looked up different solutions and even tried putting Steam into offline mode before disconnecting, but the issue still remains.

I really hope the developers address this problem.

Game does not work full screen and window is only about 75%of your screen and no online fixes seem to work do not waste your money on this. Good game but does not work on steam. If it wasn't so long ago that i purchased this I would request a refund.
game has a bug launching when not being played for a while.
Keys not rebindable & arrow keys used for map scrolling. No tutorial so I have no idea what I'm doing.
program not stable

this shit sucks video or sound will not work correctly game sop old shit is broken beyond repair
Keep buying these games and they keep not working over and over every few years. Almost like we're all purposely getting defrauded!
incomplete they should back up release without crash or issue otherwise not allowed by valve to release game this is scam by EA, this is not ok by any chance, if no support do not ask money for it!!!
game has a bug launching when not being played for a while.
Requires patches, and editing game files to get it to work

The game is absolutely terrific but, unfortunately, the campaign gets caught up and cannot save beyond a certain point. This prevents you from completing the campaign and, therefore, stops you getting all achievements done. For this reason I have to, sadly, give it a thumbs down. I have played it for many many hours and had to uninstall after discovering this.
There is no balance. Easy is just too easy. You step up to medium and you need to be a pro RTS player to keep up with the AI. Not fun
Have to play it 800 x 600 resolution, because if i try to change it (max 1920 to 1440)  image gets outside of the monitor.

90 % of the time it bugging out and doesn't work. 
Steam + this game s*cks.
Keys not rebindable & arrow keys used for map scrolling. No tutorial so I have no idea what I'm doing.
program not stable
